metadata.title: CVE-2022-38533 on Ubuntu 20.04 LTS (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
In GNU Binutils before 2.40, there is a heap-buffer-overflow in the errorfunction bfd_getl32 when called from the strip_main function in strip-newvia a crafted file.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-38533` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

binutils - 2.34-6ubuntu1.4
binutils-aarch64-linux-gnu - 2.34-6ubuntu1.4
binutils-alpha-linux-gnu - 2.34-6ubuntu1.4
binutils-arm-linux-gnueabi - 2.34-6ubuntu1.4
binutils-arm-linux-gnueabihf - 2.34-6ubuntu1.4
binutils-common - 2.34-6ubuntu1.4
binutils-for-build - 2.34-6ubuntu1.4
binutils-for-host - 2.34-6ubuntu1.4
binutils-hppa-linux-gnu - 2.34-6ubuntu1.4
binutils-hppa64-linux-gnu - 2.34-6ubuntu1.4
binutils-i686-gnu - 2.34-6ubuntu1.4
binutils-i686-kfreebsd-gnu - 2.34-6ubuntu1.4
binutils-i686-linux-gnu - 2.34-6ubuntu1.4
binutils-ia64-linux-gnu - 2.34-6ubuntu1.4
binutils-m68k-linux-gnu - 2.34-6ubuntu1.4
binutils-multiarch - 2.34-6ubuntu1.4
binutils-powerpc-linux-gnu - 2.34-6ubuntu1.4
binutils-powerpc64-linux-gnu - 2.34-6ubuntu1.4
binutils-powerpc64le-linux-gnu - 2.34-6ubuntu1.4
binutils-riscv64-linux-gnu - 2.34-6ubuntu1.4
binutils-s390x-linux-gnu - 2.34-6ubuntu1.4
binutils-sh4-linux-gnu - 2.34-6ubuntu1.4
binutils-source - 2.34-6ubuntu1.4
binutils-sparc64-linux-gnu - 2.34-6ubuntu1.4
binutils-x86-64-kfreebsd-gnu - 2.34-6ubuntu1.4
binutils-x86-64-linux-gnu - 2.34-6ubuntu1.4
binutils-x86-64-linux-gnux32 - 2.34-6ubuntu1.4
libbinutils - 2.34-6ubuntu1.4
libctf-nobfd0 - 2.34-6ubuntu1.4
libctf0 - 2.34-6ubuntu1.4
No subscription required

criterions.comment: binutils package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.34-6ubuntu1.4').
